job_description:
Business Development Executive

We are seeking a high-performing, self-driven Senior Business Development Executive to join our team at 2Base Technologies. In this role, you will generate leads, build client relationships, and drive revenue through the sale of IT services and digital solutions. This individual contributor position requires end-to-end ownership of the sales process, from prospecting to closure. If you are passionate about technology, consultative selling, and business growth, we’d love to hear from you!

Responsibilities

  • Identify and generate qualified leads via outbound channels, referrals, and market research.
  • Drive new business opportunities for web, mobile, and enterprise software development services.
  • Manage the full sales cycle: lead qualification, client communication, requirement analysis, proposal preparation, pricing, negotiation, and closure.
  • Propose tailored IT and digital transformation solutions aligned with client business objectives.
  • Build relationships with key decision-makers (Founders, CXOs, Product Owners).
  • Collaborate with delivery, design, and marketing teams to create compelling proposals and presentations.
  • Maintain CRM records and provide sales forecasts/reports.
  • Represent the company at networking events and client meetings to enhance visibility.
  • Meet/exceed monthly/quarterly revenue targets consistently.

Requirements

  • Bachelor’s degree or equivalent in IT/CS/BCA/B-Tech/CS/EC/MBA/Diploma.
  • 2–5 years of B2B sales experience in IT services/digital solutions.
  • Proven ability to manage sales pipelines and close deals independently.
  • Strong knowledge of software development services (web/mobile apps, SaaS, enterprise solutions).
  • Experience with international clients preferred.
  • Proficiency in CRM systems (Zoho, HubSpot, Salesforce) and outbound tools (LinkedIn Sales Navigator).
  • Excellent communication, presentation, and negotiation skills.
  • Ability to work autonomously with minimal supervision.
  • Strategic thinker who can address client pain points and position solutions.

Additional Experience

  • 2–5 years in sales/business development.
  • Certifications in sales, digital marketing, or business consulting are a plus.

Contact: Share your resume at careers@2basetechnologies.com.
summary: Senior Business Development Executive to drive IT services sales, manage full sales cycles, and meet revenue targets with 2-5 years of B2B experience.

job_description:
Business Analyst

The Business Analyst plays a key role in ensuring requirements are clearly understood, accurately documented, and traceable throughout the software development lifecycle. This role focuses on translating business and functional inputs into structured, standardized documentation that supports effective development, testing, and delivery. Working closely with business analysts, design teams, and technical stakeholders, the role ensures consistency, clarity, and alignment across all requirement artifacts.

Key Responsibilities

  • Create Software Requirement Specifications (SRS) based on inputs from Core Business Analysts, stakeholder discussions, and requirement walkthroughs
  • Prepare Business Requirement Documents (BRD) using approved templates while ensuring business intent and system behavior are clearly documented
  • Participate in requirement discussions to understand business objectives, functional flows, dependencies, and assumptions before documentation
  • Analyze requirements to identify gaps, ambiguities, and inconsistencies, and work with Core BAs to resolve them
  • Document functional flows, business rules, and acceptance criteria where applicable to support development and QA teams
  • Document wireframes, UI flows, validations, and UI specifications in collaboration with design and product teams
  • Maintain change logs, version history, and document updates throughout the project lifecycle
  • Create and manage traceability matrices linking business, functional, and technical requirements
  • Maintain cross-references across BRD, SRS, UI, API, and related documentation
  • Ensure documentation consistency, completeness, and alignment with approved scope and delivery timelines
  • Ensure accurate and timely PMS updates with structured documentation details
  • Support development, QA, UAT, and audit processes through clear, traceable, and up-to-date documentation
  • Assist in requirement reviews, walkthroughs, and validation sessions with internal and client stakeholders

Requirements

Required Skills and Experience

  • 1 to 4 years of experience in Business Analysis documentation or related roles
  • Strong experience in BRD and SRS creation
  • Hands-on experience with documentation templates, standards, and version control
  • Ability to document UI wireframes and functional flows clearly
  • Working knowledge of APIs and system integrations for documentation purposes
  • Experience with project management systems and documentation tools
  • Strong attention to detail and ability to manage multiple documents in parallel
  • Excellent written communication and stakeholder coordination skills

Minimum Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related field
  • 1 to 4 years of experience as a Business Analyst or Product Analyst

Benefits

  • A growth-driven environment with opportunities to lead, innovate, and upskill continuously.

If this opportunity aligns with your career goals, kindly share your updated resume with us at careers@2basetechnologies.com.
summary: The Business Analyst translates business needs into structured documentation, ensuring clarity and traceability across development. Requires 1-4 years of experience in BRD/SRS creation and UI/API documentation.

job_description:
Senior Business Analyst

At 2Base, we are rebuilding the Business Analyst function into a world-class, product-minded, clarity-driven team. This role is not a documentation role. It is not a screen updater role. It is not a support role. This is a core Business Analyst position responsible for functional modelling, system reasoning, requirement clarity, and building the foundation for correct development.

As a Senior Business Analyst, you will be the functional brain of the project. You will ensure that the right problem is understood, broken down, analysed, validated, clarified, communicated, and owned end-to-end. You will drive requirement precision, reduce rework, and enable confident and aligned delivery across teams.

Key Responsibilities - Lead requirement workshops, client calls, and discovery discussions to understand business needs clearly. - Ask deeper questions, challenge assumptions, and validate the true business intent behind every requirement. - Convert ambiguous client inputs into structured, logical, and actionable functional understanding. - Break large features into modules, workflows, components, and clear dependencies. - Build strong system-level understanding involving APIs, integrations, data flow, and backend considerations. - Translate business processes into functional logic that development teams can execute. - Decompose requirements into use-case flows, system behaviours, edge cases, alternate paths, validation rules, and dependencies. - Prepare high-quality documentation, including BRD, FRD, SRS, workflows, state diagrams, data-flow diagrams, API requirement specs, and acceptance criteria. - Ensure all documentation is clear, logical, structured, testable, and ready for developers and QA to use. - Collaborate closely with developers, architects, QA, and product owners to validate feasibility and align understanding. - Ensure QA teams can derive test cases effectively from your functional logic and acceptance criteria. - Communicate confidently with clients, handle requirement discussions smoothly, and clarify misunderstandings immediately. - Push back politely on unclear or changing requirements and ensure final decisions are documented properly. - Maintain requirement traceability throughout the lifecycle and ensure zero ambiguity during handover to development. - Own the entire requirement lifecycle from discovery to development readiness with high accountability. - Drive clarity across teams by ensuring every requirement is complete, validated, and logically consistent.

Required Skills & Experience - Minimum 4+ years of core Business Analyst experience with strong analytical and system-level thinking. - Ability to break down complex requirements into clear components, workflows, and functional logic. - Excellent verbal and written communication with confidence in client interactions and clarifications. - Proven experience in preparing SRS, BRD, FRD, workflows, and acceptance criteria with high clarity. - Ability to challenge assumptions politely, ask the right questions, and ensure zero ambiguity. - Strong collaboration experience with development, QA, architects, and cross-functional teams. - Understanding of API behaviours, integrations, data flows, and multi-module system interactions. - Ability to run requirement discussions, workshops, and independently lead discovery sessions. - Exposure to SaaS, scalable products, automation, or AI-supported systems is an added advantage. - Demonstrated ownership of requirements end-to-end, ensuring developer-ready and testable outputs. - Not suitable for UI-only thinkers, passive communicators, template-based writers, or those relying on AI for answers. - Success is defined by clear, testable requirements, zero rework, strong cross-team alignment, and confident communication. - Candidates must align with 2Base’s structured thinking, clarity-driven culture, and transformation of the BA function.

Minimum Qualifications - Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Business, or related field - 4 to 8 years of experience as a Business Analyst or Product Analyst - Experience in SaaS or scalable product environments - Exposure to AI/Automation, integrations, or multi-module systems - Ability to run independent client workshops - Must have independently handled requirement ownership for at least one full project lifecycle

Benefits - A growth-driven environment with opportunities to lead, innovate, and upskill continuously.

If this opportunity aligns with your career goals, kindly share your updated resume with us at careers@2basetechnologies.com.
summary: Senior Business Analyst role at 2Base focuses on functional modeling, system reasoning, and requirement clarity to enable precise development. Requires 4+ years of experience in structured, product-driven BA work with SaaS and API expertise.

job_description:
Senior DevSecOps Engineer

We are seeking a Senior DevSecOps Engineer to lead our cybersecurity, infrastructure automation, and DevSecOps practices as we transition to a secure, scalable, and modern engineering environment. This role will strengthen 2Base’s security posture, modernize pipelines, and foster a secure-by-design culture. You will collaborate with engineering, product, and leadership teams to ensure systems, applications, and cloud environments are secure, reliable, and future-ready.

Key Responsibilities

  • Define, implement, and enforce security standards, policies, and best practices across cloud and on-prem environments.
  • Conduct security risk assessments, vulnerability scans, penetration testing, and execute mitigation plans.
  • Architect and enhance secure CI/CD pipelines with automated compliance and governance checkpoints.
  • Promote a "Security First" culture across engineering teams.
  • Monitor, detect, investigate, and respond to security threats, incidents, breaches, and anomalies.
  • Develop Infrastructure-as-Code practices using Terraform, Ansible, and automation frameworks.
  • Design secure cloud architectures on AWS, Azure, or GCP for scalable, compliant deployments.
  • Build and secure containerized environments with Docker and Kubernetes.
  • Implement secure monitoring, logging, SIEM, and alerting systems.
  • Improve system reliability, scalability, performance, and fault tolerance.
  • Mentor DevOps engineers in secure development and operational excellence.
  • Lead technical strategy, tool selection, and DevSecOps roadmap execution.
  • Collaborate with BA, PM, and Engineering teams to align security and delivery goals.

Required Skills & Experience

  • 4–8 years in DevOps, Cloud, or Infrastructure engineering with strong security exposure.
  • Hands-on CI/CD tools (Jenkins, GitLab CI, GitHub Actions).
  • Expertise in AWS, Azure, or GCP with secure architecture focus.
  • Proficiency in Infrastructure-as-Code (Terraform, Ansible).
  • Experience securing Docker and Kubernetes environments.
  • Networking knowledge (LAN/WAN, firewalls, VPN, load balancers).
  • Familiarity with security frameworks (OWASP, NIST, CIS Benchmarks).
  • Monitoring/logging tools (Prometheus, Grafana, ELK, CloudWatch, SIEM).
  • Scripting skills (Python, Bash, Shell).
  • Strong troubleshooting, analytical, and communication skills.

Contact: Share your resume at careers@2basetechnologies.com.
summary: Lead cybersecurity and DevSecOps practices, modernize secure pipelines, and architect scalable cloud environments with infrastructure automation and containerization.

job_title: QA Engineer - AI Accuracy & Validation Testing
job_description:
QA Engineer - AI Accuracy & Validation Testing

We are seeking a QA Engineer to join our AI Quality Assurance team, focusing on accuracy, robustness, reliability, and ethical validation of AI/ML and Generative AI systems. This role goes beyond traditional QA and involves testing non-deterministic, data-driven, and probabilistic AI outputs.

Key Responsibilities

AI-Specific Testing Responsibilities

  • Perform accuracy, validation, and consistency testing for AI/ML and Generative AI applications
  • Test non-deterministic systems where the same input may produce different outputs
  • Define and validate probabilistic acceptance criteria instead of fixed expected results
  • Conduct model robustness testing using noisy, edge-case, and adversarial inputs
  • Identify and report hallucinations in Generative AI (LLMs, chatbots, NLP systems)
  • Perform prompt testing and prompt regression testing to ensure stable AI responses after model or prompt updates
  • Validate explainability and justification of AI outputs (why a model produced a specific result)
  • Execute fairness, bias, and ethical testing to detect skewed, unsafe, or discriminatory AI behaviour

Manual & Automation Testing

  • Design and execute manual test cases for AI workflows, edge cases, and real-world scenarios
  • Validate AI outputs against datasets, expected patterns, statistical thresholds, and business rules
  • Develop and maintain automation scripts using Selenium with Python for AI-driven workflows
  • Automate repetitive AI accuracy, regression, and validation tests
  • Perform regression testing after model retraining, fine-tuning, or data updates

Collaboration & Documentation

  • Work closely with AI/ML engineers and data teams to understand models, prompts, inputs, and outputs
  • Analyse incorrect or inconsistent AI responses and log high-quality, detailed defects
  • Work with structured and unstructured data (text, images, datasets) for testing
  • Document test results, observations, risks, and AI improvement recommendations
  • Participate in Agile/Scrum ceremonies and sprint QA activities

Required Skills & Qualifications

  • Completed QA training in Manual and Automation Testing
  • Strong understanding of testing fundamentals, SDLC, and STLC
  • Mandatory Python knowledge (academic projects or professional experience)
  • Mandatory experience or training in Selenium with Python
  • Ability to understand and test data-driven, logic-based, and AI-powered systems
  • Strong analytical thinking and attention to detail
  • Good verbal and written communication skills

Good to Have

  • Basic understanding of AI/ML concepts (models, datasets, accuracy, precision, recall, etc.)
  • Exposure to testing AI/ML applications, chatbots, NLP systems, LLMs, or recommendation engines
  • Familiarity with PyTest or other Python-based automation frameworks
  • Knowledge of test data preparation, validation, and labelling
  • Familiarity with Agile/Scrum methodology
  • Awareness of AI ethics, bias, and responsible AI principles

Education

  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, IT, Engineering, Data Science, or a related field

Contact: If this opportunity aligns with your career goals, kindly share your updated resume with us at joinus@pearlsofttechnologies.com
summary: QA Engineer to test AI/ML systems for accuracy, robustness, and ethical compliance. Requires QA training, Python, and Selenium skills.

The ideal candidate will play a key role in converting our .NET Framework 4 (C#) web application to .NET 8 (Core), the latest version of Microsoft’s unified .NET platform, while enhancing system performance, scalability, and maintainability. This role requires a developer with strong SQL Server expertise, capable of managing and optimizing databases independently. The candidate will also help design and integrate AI-driven functionality into our platform to enhance user experience and operational insight.

Key Responsibilities

  • Migration of existing .NET Framework 4 web applications to .NET 8.
  • Refactor and optimize legacy code for improved maintainability and performance.
  • Design and implement RESTful APIs and modern integration patterns.
  • Collaborate with UI/UX and frontend teams utilizing modern JavaScript frameworks and libraries.
  • Manage and optimize SQL Server databases, including stored procedures, indexing, and performance tuning.
  • Assist in architecting and integrating AI and machine learning capabilities into the web platform (e.g., natural language processing, predictive analytics, or generative AI features).
  • Provide technical mentorship and guidance to internal development staff.

Preferred Skills & Qualifications

  • 7+ years of professional experience in software development with a focus on C# and ASP.NET.
  • Proven experience migrating legacy applications from .NET Framework to .NET 8.
  • Proficiency in SQL Server, including query optimization, complex joins, triggers, and stored procedure development.
  • Hands-on experience with modern JavaScript libraries and frameworks (e.g., jQuery, React, or Angular).
  • Experience implementing or integrating AI/ML functionality (OpenAI API, Azure AI, or similar).
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
  • Excellent communication skills and the ability to work collaboratively within a small team.
  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field (or equivalent experience).

Interested candidates can share their CV to: gobika.g@aptaracorp.com with the subject line: Application for Senior .Net Developer
summary: Senior .NET Developer (Contract) role focuses on migrating legacy applications to .NET 8, optimizing SQL Server databases, and integrating AI/ML features. Requires 7+ years of experience in C#, ASP.NET, and modern web development.

About CareRevenue and the team

CareRevenue builds cloud platforms that modernize U.S. dental practices. We are now spinning up an independent, startup-mode team to super-charge Revenue Cycle Management (RCM) with AI, automation, and data-driven workflows. This team will operate as a tech-agnostic innovation unit focused on transforming manual RCM processes into scalable, tech-enabled solutions.

Responsibilities

  • Take untapped RCM opportunities, design full-stack solutions that solve real problems and ship them to production, and iterate on real-world feedback.
  • Select and justify the best tools/frameworks per project; implement PoCs when needed.
  • Build and maintain secure, scalable APIs, UIs, automations, and data pipelines.
  • Integrate third-party systems (EHR, CRM, payment gateways, RPA bots).
  • Uphold code quality with reviews, automated tests, CI/CD, and cloud-native best practices.
  • Mentor junior engineers in problem-solving and tech-agnostic thinking.
  • Work closely with the RCM operations team to understand pain points and identify high-impact automation opportunities.
  • Focus on measurable business outcomes rather than processes, with emphasis on RCM performance metrics improvement.

Preferred Skills

  • 8 – 12 yrs designing, coding, testing, and running production software end-to-end.
  • Proven ability to learn new stacks fast and pick “best-fit” tech (language, framework, cloud, DB) per use case.
  • Deep grasp of computer-science fundamentals, distributed systems, and REST/gRPC/GraphQL API design.
  • Solid understanding of front-end ↔ back-end integration patterns (contract design, API gateways, auth flows) and real-time communication (WebSockets, SSE, pub-sub, event streams).
  • Hands-on cloud (AWS / GCP / Azure) with container orchestration and observability.
  • Strong unit/integration testing discipline; Git & trunk-based workflows. Bias for metrics-driven decisions and rapid experimentation.
  • Outcome-focused approach that prioritizes solving real business problems over following rigid processes.
  • Excellent written & verbal communication with non-technical stakeholders.

job_description:
About Us

Muthoot Mercantile Limited is a leading Non-Banking Financial Company (NBFC) headquartered in Thiruvananthapuram, Kerala. Registered with the RBI, the company specializes in the gold loan sector and emphasizes trust, transparency, and customer relationships. With a wide branch network across multiple Indian states, Muthoot Mercantile handles customer gold assets with care and expertise.

Position Overview

We are seeking a proactive and results-driven Software Engineer - .NET to join our IT Wing. The ideal candidate will have hands-on experience in .NET Core, MVC, WPF, WCF, Angular/React, SQL, and Azure, and will provide technical leadership to a team of developers.

Key Responsibilities

  • Mentor junior team members and conduct code reviews.
  • Develop high-quality software solutions using .NET Core, Angular/React, MS SQL, and Azure.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to translate project requirements into technical specifications.
  • Troubleshoot complex technical issues and stay updated on the latest .NET technologies.
  • Participate in scrum meetings, analyze requirements, and communicate directly with clients.
  • Assign tasks to junior developers and guide their growth.
  • Manage project timelines, prioritize tasks, and ensure deadlines are met.
  • Convert legacy projects to .NET when required.
  • Learn new technologies and adapt to evolving business needs.
  • Code, debug, test, and document features while ensuring thorough testing.

Preferred Skills & Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.
  • 3+ years of experience in .NET technologies.
  • Proficiency in .NET Core, C#, MVC, WPF, WCF, Web API.
  • Strong frontend skills in Angular/React, TypeScript, HTML/CSS/JavaScript.
  • Experience with Azure services (e.g., App Service, Functions) and Azure DevOps.
  • Excellent problem-solving and communication skills.
  • Familiarity with Git and Agile methodologies.

What We Offer

  • Competitive salary and performance-based incentives.
  • Opportunities for career growth and exposure to cutting-edge technologies.
  • PF/ESI/Medical Insurance benefits.
  • A collaborative and innovative work environment.

How to Apply

Send your resume to hr@muthootenterprises.com with the subject line "Application for Software Engineer - .NET". Include details about your notice period, current CTC, and expected CTC. Visit www.muthootenterprises.com for more information.
